results.title: Carrousel
results.brief_description: A visual poem, vivid, lyrical, as intriguing in its colour fantasy as in the beauty of its images. This is an escape from a merry-go-round of painted horses suddenly turned to flesh and blood, making a wild plunge for freedom. But these are horses of extraordinary colour - lime, mauve, bronze and gold - as if caught in some mysterious kaleidoscope of the dawn. A technical triumph, these unusual effects were achieved in the printing process. (Awards: Teheran, Colombo, Tel Aviv, Philadelphia)

results.title: Carrot nose
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used to tell a story about some children who visit their grandmother at the farm where they build a snow man whose carrot nose is stolen by rabbits who need food in the wintertime.

results.title: Carried away
results.creator_credit: Destiny Deacon, Vonnie von Helmolt and Michael Scott
results.brief_description: A combination of animation and live-action which celebrates the creative process. A stylised exercise using black and white photographs to represent reality and coloured overlays representing flights of fantasy. The artist learns by trial and error to take possession of his creative energy. Useful in the areas of art, media studies and as a stimulus to discussion in English classes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Destiny Deacon, Vonnie von Helmolt and Michael Scott

results.title: Carrie (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Paul Monash and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel by Stephen King, this film is the story of a young girl who is ostracized at school because of her ‘weird’ mother and upbringing. At the onset of puberty, Carrie White (played eerily by Sissy Spacek) discovers that she has special telekinetic powers that seem to become stronger when she is angered. She is finally pushed into a no return path of bloody vengeance on her cruel classmates. Piper Laurie contributes a memorable performance as the deranged Mrs. White, Carrie’s mother. Directed by a master of suspense and in the vein of Alfred Hitchcock, this film is an excellent example of tense and stylish horror. Cast also includes John Travolta, Amy Irving and Nancy Allen.

results.title: Carreras, Domingo, Pavarotti in Concert
results.brief_description: This program features Jose Carreras, Placido Domingo and Luciano Pavarotti in concert in Caracalla, Rome, with the Orchestras of Maggio Musicale Fiorenti and Teatro Dell’ Opera di Roma conducted by Zubin Mehta.

results.title: Carpets in Bri-nylon X-21
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, British Nylon Spinners, Leon Clore and J.B. Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: The introduction of new methods and materials is revolutionizing the British carpet industry. One of the most important of these developments lies in the use of Bri-nylon X-21, a continuous filament bulked nylon yarn, on new tufting machinery to produce an article quite different from the traditional woven carpet. Describes the manufacture of these carpets and emphasises their hard wearing qualities and the ease with which they can be cleaned.

results.title: Carp in a marsh
results.brief_description: Uses natural sound and close-up photography to illustrate the mating of carp, fertilization of the eggs and the hatching of baby fish. Follows the smaller fish in their struggle for survival. No narration.

results.title: Caroms
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Crystal Gandrud
results.brief_description: Animation is used to exhibit the relationship between a carom an a reflection. This principle is used to solve elementary geometric inequalities, and to explore Fagano’s problem: To find a triangle of minimum perimeter that can be inscribed in a given acute-angled triangle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Caroline Chisholm: the emigrant's friend
results.brief_description: This incredibly energetic and intelligent woman stands out as one of the few women who have been recognised throughout Australia’s history. She was called a saint in her own lifetime. Caroline Chisholm pioneered migrant welfare and helped the most disadvantaged groups of all; the women and children, the poor and uneducated, the ignorant and the persecuted. She achieved more in her lifetime than almost anyone else in our history.

results.title: Caroline Cherie = Dear Caroline
results.creator_credit: Alain Poire, Paul Cadeac and Richard Pottier
results.brief_description:
Caroline de Bievres celebrates her 16th birthday on 14 July 1789. While the Parisians storm the Bastille, Caroline experiences love with Gaston de Sallanches. Sent to Paris by her parents, she discovers that Gaston is already married.

Credits: Producer, Alain Poire, Paul Cadeac ; director, Richard Pottier ; writer, Jean Anouilh ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Georges Auric ; art director, Jacques Krauss.
Cast: Martine Carol, Jacques Dacqmine, Pierre Cressoy, Jacques Clancy, Marie Dea, Daniele Seller, Paul Bernard, Alfred Adam, Raymond Souplex, Marthe Mercadier, Nadine Alari, Yvonne de Bray, Marie Dea, Olivier Hussenot.
